docs.text: Janne Pott Welcome to my homepage! I am a genetic epidemiologist working on genome-wide association studies and causal inference models (aka Mendelian Randomization). Research Objective The goal of my research is to contribute to personalized medicine via genetic epidemiology. This includes analyzing the molecular sex differences in multiple OMICS levels as well as the different risk profile for various diseases, which are also age-dependent. For this, I use genetic summary statistics from large-scale studies, genetic consortia and electronic health data in causal models of Mendelian Randomization. Current projects Multivariate MR (MVMR) using longitudinal exposure data real data application 1: estimated foetal weight on actual birth weight real data application 2: total cholesterol levels on risk for coronary artery disease (stratified by sex) MR of steroid hormones on gene expression levels MVMR of age at menarche and age at menopause on disease risk in women Contact Information Medical Research Council (MRC) - Biostatistics Unit (BSU) University of Cambridge Email / LinkedIn / GitHub / Twitter / ORCID Last updated: 01.12.2024

docs.text: Curriculum Vitae Current position Postdoctoral Research Associate (since 03/2023), MRC BSU , University of Cambridge, Cambridge, UK Development of MR methods for longitudinal data and time-varying effects Performing MR analyses with sex-biased exposure and outcome data Previous positions Postdoctoal Research Associate (07/2018 – 02/2023), IMISE , Leipzig University, Leipzig, GER Performing meta-GWAS with gene x environment effects Development and maintaining of analysis pipelines for molecular data Preprocessing of multiomic data in the LIFE studies PhD student (07/2015 – 06/2018), IMISE , Leipzig University, Leipzig, GER Performing GWAS on markers of cardiovascular disease Preprocessing of the genomic data in the LIFE studies Education PhD in Statistical Genetics (2019) , Faculty of Medicine, University Leipzig , Leipzig, GER MSc in Biomathematics (2015) , Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Greifswald , Greifswald, Germany BSc in Integrated Life Sciences (2012) , Faculty of Science, Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg , Erlangen, Germany Funding Sex-specific causal effects of steroid hormones and adipokines on cardiovascular disease (SASHA), Helmholtz Institute for Metabolic, Obesity and Vascular Research ( HI-MAG ), Leipzig, GER; role: applicant/project manager Leadership roles Organization of the Causal Mechanism theme meetings , MRC BSU, Cambridge, UK Public outreach MR Conference - Public engagement and involvement session , Bristol, UK, 20.
